Source code for heliolib.metadata_extraction_service.get_metainfo

import logging

import pandas as pd

from heliolib.metadata_extraction_service import MetadataAPI

SURFACE_TILT_MIN_VALUE = 0
SURFACE_TILT_MAX_VALUE = 90
SURFACE_AZIMUTH_MIN_VALUE = 0
SURFACE_AZIMUTH_MAX_VALUE = 359

logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)




[docs]
class SystemInfoMetadataAPI:
    def __init__(self, meta_db_api: MetadataAPI):
        """
        Initialize the SystemInfoMetadataAPI class.

        Parameters
        ----------
        meta_db_api : MetadataAPI
            An instance of MetadataAPI used for data retrieval.
        """
        self.metadb_client = meta_db_api
        self.array_info = None
        self.plant_id = None
        self.plant_table = None
        self.reference_date = None

    def _initialize_new_array_info(self) -> None:
        """
        Initialize a new DataFrame for array information.
        """
        self.array_info = pd.DataFrame()

    def _initialize_plant_table(self):
        """
        Initialize the plant table with data from the MetadataAPI.
        """
        self.plant_table = self.metadb_client.get_plant_info_from_plant_id(
            self.plant_id
        )

    def _merge_input_information(self, plant_attributes: pd.DataFrame) -> None:
        """
        Merge plant attributes based on different boolean conditions related to combiners, strings, and MPPTs.

        Parameters
        ----------
        plant_attributes : pd.DataFrame
            pd.DataFrame containing plant attributes.

        Returns
        -------
        pd.DataFrame
            Merged DataFrame based on the given conditions.
        """
        # Case 1: Combiner exists and string does not exist
        # Condition1 : At least one non-null values in combiner-id column in plant attribute table
        # Condition2 : All null values in string-id column in plant attribute table
        if (not plant_attributes["combiner_id"].isna().any()) & (
            plant_attributes["string_id"].isna().all()
        ):
            # Merge Plant Attributes Table with CB Table
            cb_table = self.metadb_client.get_combiners(self.plant_id)
            cols_to_merge_on = ["plant_id", "inv_id", "mppt_id", "combiner_id"]
            cols_to_drop = ["string_id", "cb_id"]

            # Check if any empty cell in "cols_to_merge_on"
            if cb_table[cols_to_merge_on].isnull().values.any():
                raise ValueError("Error: CB-Table in MetadB contains empty cells.")

            self.array_info = cb_table.merge(plant_attributes, on=cols_to_merge_on)
            self.array_info = self.array_info.drop(columns=cols_to_drop)
            return self.array_info

        # Case 2: Combiner may or may not exist but string exist
        # Condition1 : At least one non-null values in string-id column in plant attribute table
        if not plant_attributes["string_id"].isna().all():
            # Merge Plant Attributes Table with String Table
            string_table = self.metadb_client.get_strings(self.plant_id)
            cols_to_merge_on = ["plant_id", "inv_id", "mppt_id", "string_id"]
            cols_to_drop = ["string_id_fk"]

            # Check if any empty cell in "cols_to_merge_on"
            if string_table[cols_to_merge_on].isnull().values.any():
                raise ValueError("Error: String-Table in MetadB contains empty cells.")

            # Drop Combiner-id if its empty
            if string_table["combiner_id"].isna().all():
                string_table = string_table.drop(columns=["combiner_id"])
                cols_to_drop += ["combiner_id"]
            else:
                cols_to_merge_on += ["combiner_id"]

            self.array_info = string_table.merge(plant_attributes, on=cols_to_merge_on)
            self.array_info = self.array_info.drop(columns=cols_to_drop)
            return self.array_info

        # Case 3: Data only exists at MPPT level
        # Condition1 : All null values in combiner-id column in plant attribute table
        # Condition2 : All null values in string-id column in plant attribute table
        if (plant_attributes["combiner_id"].isna().all()) & (
            plant_attributes["string_id"].isna().all()
        ):
            # Merge Plant Attributes Table with MPPT Table
            mppt_table = self.metadb_client.get_mppts(self.plant_id)
            cols_to_merge_on = ["plant_id", "inv_id", "mppt_id"]
            cols_to_drop = ["string_id", "mppt_id_fk"]

            # Check if any empty cell in "cols_to_merge_on"
            if mppt_table[cols_to_merge_on].isnull().values.any():
                raise ValueError("Error: MPPT-Table in MetadB contains empty cells.")

            # Drop Combiner-id since its empty
            if mppt_table["combiner_id"].isna().all():
                mppt_table = mppt_table.drop(columns=["combiner_id"])
                cols_to_drop += ["combiner_id"]

            self.array_info = mppt_table.merge(plant_attributes, on=cols_to_merge_on)
            self.array_info = self.array_info.drop(columns=cols_to_drop)
            return self.array_info

    def _extract_panel_info_from_meta(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
        """
        Extract panel information from MetadataAPI.

        Returns
        -------
        panel_info: pd.DataFrame
            Panel information DataFrame.
        """
        panel_info = pd.DataFrame()
        for panel_id in self.array_info.panel_id.unique():
            selected_panel = self.metadb_client.get_panel_info(panel_id)
            panel_info = pd.concat([panel_info, selected_panel])
        return panel_info



[docs]
    def merge_panel_information(self):
        """
        Merge information related to panels into array_info.
        """
        logger.debug("Merging panel info to array_info.")

        panel_df = self._extract_panel_info_from_meta()

        self.array_info = self.array_info.merge(panel_df, on="panel_id")

        # Rename "wattage" to "panel_wattage"
        self.array_info = self.array_info.rename(columns={"wattage": "panel_wattage"})

        # Perform some calculations
        self.array_info["number_of_modules"] = (
            self.array_info["modules_per_string"] * self.array_info["number_of_strings"]
        )

        # The final array_info has the value in Watts, so no dividing by 1000
        self.array_info["installed_capacity"] = (
            self.array_info["number_of_modules"] * self.array_info["panel_wattage"]
        )

        self.array_info[["gamma", "beta", "alpha"]] = (
            0.01 * self.array_info[["gamma", "beta", "alpha"]]
        )

        # Add Expected Degradation to Array Info
        if self.plant_table["system_age"].iloc[0] > 1:
            self.array_info["expected_degradation"] = self.array_info["degrdn_yr1"] + (
                (self.plant_table["system_age"].iloc[0] - 1)
                * self.array_info["degrdn_yr2"]
            )
        else:
            self.array_info["expected_degradation"] = self.array_info["degrdn_yr1"]

        # Drop unnecessary columns
        self.array_info = self.array_info.drop(
            columns=[
                "panel_id",
                "manufacturer",
                "model_name",
                "topology",
                "nominal_efficiency",
            ]
        )





[docs]
    def get_orientation_col(self) -> str:
        """
        Get the DataFrame column holding the correct orientation details.

        Returns
        -------
        col_to_keep: str
            The column name corresponding to the provided date's month followed by '_data'.
        """
        date_month = self.reference_date.strftime("%b").lower()
        col_to_keep = date_month + "_data"
        return col_to_keep



    def _get_orientation_info_from_meta(self, orientation_col: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
        """
        Get orientation information from MetadataAPI.

        Parameters
        ----------
        orientation_col : str
            The column name in orientation_df containing orientation values.

        Returns
        -------
        orient_info: pd.DataFrame
            Orientation information DataFrame.
        """
        orient_info = pd.DataFrame()
        for orient_id in self.array_info.orientation_id.unique():
            selected_orientation = self.metadb_client.get_orientation_info(
                orient_id, self.plant_id
            )
            selected_orientation = selected_orientation[
                ["orientation_id", orientation_col]
            ].copy()
            orient_info = pd.concat([orient_info, selected_orientation])

        return orient_info



[docs]
    def merge_orientation_information(self) -> None:
        """
        Merge orientation information into array_info DataFrame.
        """
        logger.debug("Merging orientation info to array_info.")

        orientation_col = self.get_orientation_col()
        orientation_df = self._get_orientation_info_from_meta(orientation_col)

        orientation_df[["surface_tilt", "surface_azimuth"]] = orientation_df[
            orientation_col
        ].str.split(",", expand=True)
        # Remove the double quotes
        orientation_df.replace(to_replace='"', value="", regex=True, inplace=True)
        # Make surface tilt and azimuth as an integer
        orientation_df[["surface_tilt", "surface_azimuth"]] = orientation_df[
            ["surface_tilt", "surface_azimuth"]
        ].astype(float)
        orientation_df.drop(columns=[orientation_col], inplace=True)

        # Validate Tilt and Azimuth are in expected range, else raise Error
        if (
            not orientation_df["surface_tilt"]
            .between(SURFACE_TILT_MIN_VALUE, SURFACE_TILT_MAX_VALUE)
            .all()
        ):
            raise ValueError(
                "Error: Surface Tilt Values outside expected range in MetaDB!"
            )
        if (
            not orientation_df["surface_azimuth"]
            .between(SURFACE_AZIMUTH_MIN_VALUE, SURFACE_AZIMUTH_MAX_VALUE)
            .all()
        ):
            raise ValueError(
                "Error: Surface Azimuth Values outside expected range in MetaDB!"
            )

        # Check if any Duplicate Orientation Values Exists
        if not orientation_df[
            orientation_df.duplicated(["surface_tilt", "surface_azimuth"])
        ].empty:
            raise ValueError("Duplicate Orientation Values Found in MetaDB!")

        # Merge orientation information into array_info DataFrame
        self.array_info = self.array_info.merge(orientation_df, on="orientation_id")

        # Drop the orientation_id column
        self.array_info = self.array_info.drop(columns=["orientation_id"])





[docs]
    def merge_inverter_information(self) -> None:
        """
        Merge information from various tables related to inverters into array_info.
        """
        logger.debug("Merging inverter info to array_info.")

        # Fetch Inverter Information
        inverter_table = self.metadb_client.get_inverters(self.plant_id)

        inverters_info = pd.DataFrame()
        for inverters_id in inverter_table.inverters_id.unique():
            selected_inverter = self.metadb_client.get_inverter_specs(inverters_id)
            inverters_info = pd.concat([inverters_info, selected_inverter])

        # Rename inverter capacity as "ac-capacity"
        inverter_table = inverter_table.rename(
            columns={"inverter_capacity": "ac_capacity"}
        )

        # Merge inverter_table and inverters_info based on 'inverters_id'
        complete_inverter_table = inverter_table.merge(
            inverters_info, on=["inverters_id"]
        )

        # Drop unnecessary columns
        complete_inverter_table = complete_inverter_table.drop(
            columns=[
                "manufacturer",
                "inverter_model",
                "inv_id_fk",
                "inverter_name",
                "inverters_id",
            ]
        )

        """To Do: Modify "dc_current, dc_voltage, dc_power, inverter_capacity"
         according to data level"""
        # Merge step_df with complete_inverter_table
        self.array_info = self.array_info.merge(
            complete_inverter_table, on=["plant_id", "inv_id"]
        )





[docs]
    def reformat_plant_table_to_create_general_info_dataframe(self) -> None:
        """
        Rename and drop columns in the plant_table DataFrame to create a general information DataFrame.
        """
        self.plant_table.rename(
            columns={"plant_id": "ID", "plant_id_fk": "name", "elevation": "altitude"},
            inplace=True,
        )
        self.plant_table[["altitude", "longitude", "latitude"]] = self.plant_table[
            ["altitude", "longitude", "latitude"]
        ].astype(float)



    def _create_array_info_index_level(self) -> None:
        """
        Create columns corresponding to levels in the DataFrame.
        """
        # Assigning default level as -1 because we want first level as "0"
        level_id = -1
        index_columns = []
        index_level_names = []

        if "string_id" in self.array_info.columns:
            if not self.array_info["string_id"].isna().all():
                # Add +1 to level_id
                level_id += 1
                # Add "string_id" to index level
                index_columns += ["string_id"]
                index_level_names += [f"ag_level_{level_id}"]
                self.array_info[f"ag_level_{level_id}"] = self.array_info[
                    "string_id"
                ].astype(str)

        if "combiner_id" in self.array_info.columns:
            if not self.array_info["combiner_id"].isna().all():
                # Increase level id by 1 incase string level data exists
                level_id += 1
                index_columns += ["combiner_id"]
                index_level_names += [f"ag_level_{level_id}"]
                self.array_info[f"ag_level_{level_id}"] = self.array_info[
                    "combiner_id"
                ].astype(str)

        # Add Default Index Levels
        index_columns += ["mppt_id", "inv_id"]
        index_level_names += [f"ag_level_{level_id + 1}", f"ag_level_{level_id + 2}"]

        # Convert 'inv_id' and 'mppt_id' to strings
        self.array_info[index_level_names] = self.array_info[index_columns].astype(str)

        # Drop unnecessary columns
        index_level_names = sorted(index_level_names, reverse=True)
        self.array_info.set_index(index_level_names, inplace=True)

    def _validate_plant_id(self, plant_id: int) -> None:
        """
        Validate the plant_id.

        Parameters
        ----------
        plant_id : int
            The ID of the plant.

        Raises
        ------
        ValueError:
            If the plant_id is not valid.
        """
        # Check if plant_id is of valid-type
        try:
            self.plant_id = int(plant_id)
        except Exception as e:
            # If conversion fails, raise an informative ValueError
            raise ValueError("Incorrect plant_id Type: Not-a-number.") from e

    def _validate_reference_date_format(self, reference_date: str):
        """
        Validates and sanitizes the reference date.

        Parameters
        ----------
        reference_date : str or None
            Date string in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.

        Returns
        -------
        datetime:
            Validated and sanitized reference date as a datetime object.

        Raises
        ------
        ValueError:
            If the reference date format is incorrect.
        """
        if reference_date is None or reference_date == "":
            # If reference_date is None or empty, set it to the current datetime
            raise ValueError(
                "Incorrect Reference Date parameter provided. Please use format 'YYYY-MM-DD'."
            )
        else:
            try:
                # Attempt to convert the reference_date to datetime using pandas
                self.reference_date = pd.to_datetime(reference_date)
                logger.info(
                    f"Reference Date being used for Meta Data is"
                    f"{self.reference_date.strftime('%Y-%m-%d')}"
                )
            except ValueError as e:
                # If conversion fails, raise an informative ValueError
                raise ValueError(
                    "Incorrect Reference Date Format! Please use 'YYYY-MM-DD'."
                ) from e

            if not isinstance(self.reference_date, pd.Timestamp):
                raise ValueError(
                    "Incorrect Reference Date Format! Please use 'YYYY-MM-DD'."
                )

    def _validate_reference_date_with_commissioning_date(self) -> None:
        """
        Validate if the reference date is not older than the system start date.

        Raises
        ------
        ValueError:
            If the reference date is older than the system start date.
        """
        # Ensure 'system_start_date' column exists in the plant_table
        if self.plant_table["system_start_date"].empty:
            raise ValueError(
                "Error: Column 'system_start_date' not found in plant_table."
            )

        system_start_date = pd.to_datetime(
            self.plant_table["system_start_date"].iloc[0], dayfirst=True
        )
        if system_start_date >= self.reference_date:
            raise ValueError("Error: Reference Date is older than System Start Date.")

    def _drop_empty_inputs(self) -> None:
        """
        Drop rows with empty inputs in the array_info DataFrame.

        Raises
        ------
        ValueError:
            If inconsistent data is found.
        """
        if not self.array_info[
            (self.array_info["number_of_strings"] == 0)
            & (self.array_info["modules_per_string"] != 0)
        ].empty:
            raise ValueError(
                "Error: Found inputs with 'number_of_strings' as zero and"
                "'modules_per_string' as non-zero."
            )

        if not self.array_info[
            (self.array_info["number_of_strings"] != 0)
            & (self.array_info["modules_per_string"] == 0)
        ].empty:
            raise ValueError(
                "Error: Found inputs with 'number_of_strings' as non-zero but"
                " 'modules_per_string' as zero."
            )

        # Drop inputs with "zero-strings" and "zero-modules"
        self.array_info = self.array_info[
            ~(
                (self.array_info["number_of_strings"] == 0)
                & (self.array_info["modules_per_string"] == 0)
            )
        ]

    def _add_system_age_to_plant_table(self) -> None:
        """
        Add the system age to the plant_table DataFrame.
        """
        logger.debug(
            "Add the system age calculated using reference_date to the plant_table."
        )

        system_start_date = pd.to_datetime(
            self.plant_table["system_start_date"].iloc[0], dayfirst=True
        )
        self.plant_table["system_age"] = (
            self.reference_date - system_start_date
        ).days / 365

    def _merge_tracker_information(self) -> None:
        """
        Merge tracker information into array_info DataFrame if trackers exist in the plant.
        """
        if "tracker_exists" in self.plant_table.columns:
            # If tracker exists in the given plant, then merge Tracker Information
            if bool(self.plant_table["tracker_exists"].iloc[0]):
                logger.debug("Merging tracker info to array_info.")
                tracker_info = self.metadb_client.get_trackers(self.plant_id)
                self.array_info = self.array_info.merge(
                    tracker_info, on=["tracker_id", "plant_id"]
                )
                self.array_info = self.array_info.sort_index()

            else:
                # Else, drop extra columns and Sort the Array Info
                self.array_info = self.array_info.drop(
                    columns=["tracker_id", "sensor_id"]
                )
                self.array_info = self.array_info.sort_index()



[docs]
    def get_plant_meta_data(self, plant_id, reference_date: str) -> tuple:
        """
        Gather inputs for plant analysis.

        Parameters
        ----------
        plant_id : int
            The ID of the plant to gather inputs for.
        reference_date : str or None
            The reference date for analysis in format YYYY-MM-DD

        Returns
        -------
        tuple:
            A tuple containing array_information and plant_table DataFrame.

        Notes:
        - The index of array_info will have multiple levels depending on the data.
        - The maximum index levels can be 4, i.e., Inverter, MPPT, Combiner, and String.
        - The minimum index levels can be 2, i.e., Inverter and MPPT.
        """
        logger.info("Initial Meta Data Fetcher from MetaDB.")

        # Initialize new-aray-info
        self._initialize_new_array_info()
        self._validate_plant_id(plant_id)
        self._initialize_plant_table()

        self._validate_reference_date_format(reference_date)
        self._validate_reference_date_with_commissioning_date()

        self._add_system_age_to_plant_table()
        self.reformat_plant_table_to_create_general_info_dataframe()

        # Fetch Plant Attributes
        plant_attributes = self.metadb_client.get_plant_attributes(plant_id)
        plant_attributes["panel_id"] = plant_attributes["panel_id"].astype(int)

        # Merge input information based on plant attributes
        self._merge_input_information(plant_attributes)
        self._drop_empty_inputs()

        self.merge_panel_information()
        self.merge_orientation_information()
        self.merge_inverter_information()
        self._merge_tracker_information()
        self._create_array_info_index_level()

        return self.array_info, self.plant_table
